zone.line: The shadow of white Death had has past
at last
From my path in Heaven has past
The cold still shadow of an icy sleep
frost & nought
Which made the
clinging solid snow
And solid shroud of clinging
Whi
warmth
As the dissolving light of Dawn may fold
A half-unfrozen dew globe green & gold
And chrystalline, till it becomes a winged mist
And wanders up the vault of the blue day
Outlives the noon & on the Suns last ray
Hangs on the sea, a fleece of fire & amethyst
The Moon
Thou art lying folded, thou art lying
In the light which is undying
Agesilaus Plu
Agesilaus had something the matter with his
legs — he had the spirit to laugh at it himself
